channel.title: [PI] PvP Facing and Tele Problem
channel.description:
If this is client sided, sorry for the wrong section. I am pretty sure its belongs in this section but I could be wrong.
Problem 1: In my 317 PI when people begin fighting, one of the pkers will be facing one way while the other is facing the correct way. He doesn't move the wrong way, he just doesn't move to the right side at all. Can someone help me with this please? Would hate if this bug lasts any longer.
Problem 2: In my spellbook, the gwd teleport won't work for whatever reason. I tried everything that I could think of but it would not teleport the player.

item.title: [PI] PvP Facing and Tele Problem
item.dc:creator: @igli igli
item.description:
@igli wrote:

[quote=“ApocalypseX, post:2, topic:445998”]I’m not sure on this, but as for problem 1:
in your attackplayer.java, find the “Attack” instance where the player actually attacks another player, add somewhere in that method “c.facePlayer”… i think that’s the code. Not entirely sure.

Problem 2: When you click on the teleport button, in your client CMD it should pop up “actionbutton: #####”, where those numbers are, add in clickingbuttons.java (src.server.models.players.packets)…

case: ####
c.getPA().movePlayer(XXXX, YYYY, H);
break;

fill in the #'s with the actionbutton number you get from your cmd, and with your XXXX and YYYY and H, fill in the coordinates (X coord, Y coord, and Height).
Hope I helped![/quote]

Thank you I will try your suggestions, however, on the first one. I did put c.facePlayer (which i believe is the right code) but still nothing happened.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] PvP Facing and Tele Problem
item.dc:creator: @ApocalypseX ApocalypseX
item.description:
@ApocalypseX wrote:

[quote=“igli, post:1, topic:445998”]If this is client sided, sorry for the wrong section. I am pretty sure its belongs in this section but I could be wrong.

Problem 1: In my 317 PI when people begin fighting, one of the pkers will be facing one way while the other is facing the correct way. He doesn’t move the wrong way, he just doesn’t move to the right side at all. Can someone help me with this please? Would hate if this bug lasts any longer.

Problem 2: In my spellbook, the gwd teleport won’t work for whatever reason. I tried everything that I could think of but it would not teleport the player.[/quote]
I’m not sure on this, but as for problem 1:
in your attackplayer.java, find the “Attack” instance where the player actually attacks another player, add somewhere in that method “c.facePlayer”… i think that’s the code. Not entirely sure.

Problem 2: When you click on the teleport button, in your client CMD it should pop up “actionbutton: #####”, where those numbers are, add in clickingbuttons.java (src.server.models.players.packets)…

case: ####
c.getPA().movePlayer(XXXX, YYYY, H);
break;

fill in the #'s with the actionbutton number you get from your cmd, and with your XXXX and YYYY and H, fill in the coordinates (X coord, Y coord, and Height).
Hope I helped!

Read full topic

Problem 2: In my spellbook, the gwd teleport won’t work for whatever reason. I tried everything that I could think of but it would not teleport the player.
